rename.from: Getting error processing LSP response from sourcekit on complex iOS project

body:
Thanks for the report. Can you try the development version? 

- The [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page has pre-built archives for Linux/Windows/macOS. 
- Check `:version` to confirm that you are using the latest version.
Hi @justinmk , it still happens on NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2913+g5371ed36b

body: Please provide a minimal detailed steps to reproduce

issue.title: Invalid range when going to package definition

repository.name: nixd
repository.description: Nix language server, based on nix libraries [maintainer=@inclyc,@Aleksanaa]

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When going to package definition `character` parameter in Range is always the same as `line`. It often goes beyond line length when line number is more than 100. I don't know about another lsp clients, but it causes errors in neovim.

**Logs (Required)**

<!-- Please provide your LSP logs here, logs always helps debugging  --->
<!-- For vscode users, you can get LSP logs in the "Nix" section --->
<!-- If there seems not to be related, please export NIXD_FLAGS="-log=verbose" in your env -->
```
/bin/nixd"      "stderr"        'I[15:13:59.346] 642047: --> reply:textDocument/definition(9)\nV[15:13:59.346] 642047: 
>>> {"id":9,"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":{"range":{"end":{"character":32,"line":32},"start":{"character":32,"line":32}},"ur
i":"file:///home/stas/upstream/nixpkgs/pkgs/servers/bindle/default.nix"}}\n'
...
/bin/nixd"      "stderr"        'E[15:14:47.889] 642047: cannot get static def location: cannot find variable on given 
position\nI[15:14:47.889] 642047: --> reply:textDocument/definition(10)\nV[15:14:47.889] 642047: >>> {"id":10,"jsonrpc"
:"2.0","result":{"range":{"end":{"character":47,"line":47},"start":{"character":47,"line":47}},"uri":"file:///home/stas
/upstream/nixpkgs/pkgs/devel'
...
[ERROR][2024-06-12 15:17:08] .../vim/lsp/rpc.lua:770    "rpc"   "/nix/store/f9pyb2jln8hdwkpxl46wk4fs0lvr1bz9-nixd-2.2.0
/bin/nixd"      "stderr"        '2.0","result":{"range":{"end":{"character":47,"line":47},"start":{"character":47,"line
":47}},"uri":"file:///home/stas/up'
...
/bin/nixd"      "stderr"        'E[15:17:37.528] 642047: cannot get static def location: cannot find variable on given 
position\nI[15:17:37.528] 642047: --> reply:textDocument/definition(12)\nV[15:17:37.528] 642047: >>> {"id":12,"jsonrpc"
:"2.0","result":{"range":{"end":{"character":35,"line":35},"start":{"character":35,"line":35}},"uri":"fi'
...
/bin/nixd"      "stderr"        'V[15:18:57.393] 642047: <<< {"id":22,"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":{"Description":"The \\"A
ctivate Windows\\" watermark ported to Linux","Homepage":"https://github.com/MrGlockenspiel/activate-linux","LongDescri
ption":null,"Name":"activate-linux-1.1.0","PName":"activate-linux","Position":"/home/stas/upstream/nixpkgs/pkgs/applica
tions/misc/activate-linux/default.nix:64","Version":"1.1.0"}}\nI[15:18:57.393] 642047: <-- reply(22)\nE[15:18:57.393] 6
42047: cannot get static def location: cannot find variable on given position\nI[15:18:57.393] 642047: --> reply:textDo
cument/definition(20)\nV[15:18:57.393] 642047: >>> {"id":20,"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":{"range":{"end":{"character":64,"l
ine":64},"start":{"character":64,"line":64}},"uri":"file:///home/stas/upstream/nixpkgs/pkgs/applications/misc/activate-
linux/default.nix"}}\n'
```
Notice that character is the same as line in the responses (32, 47, 35, 64 etc).

**Configuration**

If you have some custom configuration, please paste it here.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `pkgs/top-level/all-packages.nix` in nixpkgs
2. Try to go to definition for various packages in this file

**Expected behavior**
`character` should be within line length.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

body:
> Please provide a minimal detailed steps to reproduce

Hey, maybe it's not exactly the same issue, but `locations_to_items` (which is used in `vim.lsp.buf.definition` function) also is not tolerating ranges which go beyond line length.

LSP spec [states](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#position) that "if the character value is greater than the line length it defaults back to the line length", but `locations_to_items` gives the error in that case.

Here is a reproducer. `minimal_init.lua`:

```lua
---Definition provider, returns static result
---@param uri string
---@return lsp.Definition
local function go_to_definition(uri)
  ---@type lsp.Definition
  local result = {
    -- Document start
    {
      uri = uri,
      range = { start = { line = 0, character = 0 }, ["end"] = { line = 0, character = 0 } },
    },
    -- More than line length
    {
      uri = uri,
      range = { start = { line = 1, character = 1000 }, ["end"] = { line = 1, character = 1000 } },
    },
  }
  return result
end

---Fake LSP server
---@param dispatchers vim.lsp.rpc.Dispatchers
---@return vim.lsp.rpc.PublicClient
local function fake_server(dispatchers)
  local request_id = 0

  ---@type vim.lsp.rpc.PublicClient
  local client = {
    request = function(method, params, callback, notify_reply_callback)
      request_id = request_id + 1

      local function response(result)
        vim.schedule(function()
          if notify_reply_callback then
            notify_reply_callback(request_id)
          end
          callback(nil, result)
        end)
      end

      -- Initialization
      if method == vim.lsp.protocol.Methods.initialize then
        ---@type lsp.InitializeResult
        local result = { capabilities = { definitionProvider = true } }
        response(result)

      -- Goto Definition Request
      elseif method == vim.lsp.protocol.Methods.textDocument_definition then
        ---@cast params lsp.DefinitionParams
        response(go_to_definition(params.textDocument.uri))
      else
        return false
      end

      return true, request_id
    end,

    notify = function(method, params)
      return true
    end,

    is_closing = function()
      return false
    end,

    terminate = function()
      dispatchers.on_exit(0, 0)
    end,
  }
  return client
end

-- Start LSP client
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("BufEnter", {
  callback = function()
    vim.lsp.start({
      cmd = fake_server,
    })
  end,
})

-- Go to definition mapping
vim.keymap.set("n", "gd", vim.lsp.buf.definition)
```

It uses dummy client, that always returns static go to definition responses. One is at zero document position, second with `character` parameter that is greater than line length.

To use it, run neovim: `nvim --clean --noplugin -u minimal_init.lua minimal_init.lua`, then run command `:lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()` or use `gd` mapping anywhere in a document. Instead of showing LSP locations it errors with `index out of range` issue:

```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: ...nvim.a8t6Rav/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/util.lua:1802: index out 
of range                                                                                                               
stack traceback:                                                                                                       
        [C]: in function '_str_byteindex_enc'                                                                          
        ...nvim.a8t6Rav/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/util.lua:1802: in function 'locations_to_items'             
        ....a8t6Rav/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/handlers.lua:436: in function 'handler'                         
        ...im.a8t6Rav/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/client.lua:687: in function 'callback'                        
        /home/stas/other/reproducers/minimal_init.lua:37: in function </home/stas/other/reproducers/minimal_init.lua:33
```

issue.title: fix(lsp): handle locations exceeding line length

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem:

LSP spec [states](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#position) that "if the character value is greater than the line length it defaults back to the line length", but `locations_to_items` gives the error in that case.

Solution:
Adjust locations_to_items to follow the spec.

closes #28281

body:
The original request to "just ignore errors" isn't really actionable, but this reference is useful:

> LSP spec [states](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#position) that "if the character value is greater than the line length it defaults back to the line length", but `locations_to_items` gives the error in that case.
